defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: Default value of the parameter. If a default value is provided then the parameter is implied not to be required.

required.title: Required
required.description: Whether the parameter is required or not. A parameter is required unless this option is set to false or a default value has been configured.

shutdownRoute.description: To control how to shut down the route.

shutdownRunningTask.description: To control how to shut down the route.

org.apache.camel.model.PropertyDefinitio.title: Property
org.apache.camel.model.PropertyDefinitio.description: A key value pair where the value is a literal value

org.apache.camel.model.InputTypeDefiniti.title: Input Type
org.apache.camel.model.InputTypeDefiniti.description: Set the expected data type of the input message. If the actual message type is different at runtime, camel look for a required Transformer and apply if exists. If validate attribute is true then camel applies Validator as well. Type name consists of two parts, 'scheme' and 'name' connected with ':'. For Java type 'name' is a fully qualified class name. For example {code java:java.lang.String} , {code json:ABCOrder} . It's also possible to specify only scheme part, so that it works like a wildcard. If only 'xml' is specified, all the XML message matches. It's handy to add only one transformer/validator for all the transformation from/to XML.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

validate.title: Validate
validate.description: Whether if validation is required for this input type.

org.apache.camel.model.OutputTypeDefinit.title: Output Type
org.apache.camel.model.OutputTypeDefinit.description: Set the expected data type of the output message. If the actual message type is different at runtime, camel look for a required Transformer and apply if exists. If validate attribute is true then camel applies Validator as well. Type name consists of two parts, 'scheme' and 'name' connected with ':'. For Java type 'name' is a fully qualified class name. For example {code java:java.lang.String} , {code json:ABCOrder} . It's also possible to specify only scheme part, so that it works like a wildcard. If only 'xml' is specified, all the XML message matches. It's handy to add only one transformer/validator for all the XML-Java transformation.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

validate.title: Validate
validate.description: Whether if validation is required for this output type.
